alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 12:32PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from rapid snowmelt will continue to produce minor flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations. Rural roads and campgrounds could be impacted where creeks and streams rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1225 PM PDT, minor flooding is ongoing or likely to occur near smaller creeks and streams in the advisory area, as warm temperatures continue to melt the high elevation snowmelt. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mammoth Lakes, Mono Lake, Lee Vining, June Lake, Bodie, Crowley Lake, Toms Place, Benton, Bridgeport, Twin Lakes, Chalfant, Sonora Pass, Coleville, Crestview, Mammoth Mountain, Conway Summit, Benton Hot Springs, Bridgeport Reservoir, Robinson Creek Campground and Devils Gate Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Anyone planning outdoor recreation in Mono County should be prepared to adjust plans due to flood impacts. The highest flows on creeks often occur at night or early in the morning.
